Authors: Amelda B., Erna Bernadetta S., Jesselyn
Title: Analysis of early detection system of banking industry in indonesia on shock
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Accounting Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Amelda, B., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Accounting Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Erna Bernadetta, S., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Accounting Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Jesselyn, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Departement, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The emergence of technology or digitalization of fintech amid tight liquidity pressures and a slowdown in the global economy, greatly affects the performance of banks as intermediary institutions that are vulnerable to risk. However, if risks are left uncontrolled and not treated soon, they will create systemic risks that can create substantial costs. For this reason, early detection needs to be done in the context of prevention before a crisis occurs. This study aims to determine the level vulnerability of banking industry to the shocks and the bank's resilience profile to shocks in the midst of FinTech developments. The analytical method used in this study is logit regression, which starts with calculating indexation to measure the level of bank vulnerability to shocks. The data used in this study includes banks financial statements and macroeconomic data. The results showed that exchange rate pressures and Non-Performing Loans had the largest contribution as the cause of bank vulnerability with a probability value of 2.363% and 2.006%. Bank Rakyat Indonesia Syariah is the most unstable and most vulnerable bank to the shocks during the 2016-2018 period. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Early warning system; Insert; Systemic risk
Index Keywords: Economics; Fintech; Information management; Logistic regression; Analytical method; Banking industry; Early detection system; Exchange rates; Financial statements; Global economies; Indonesia; Systemic risks; Banking
